As an AI language model, I don't have personal experiences or emotions, but I can provide some tips on how a beginner can track their progress and set realistic goals when starting a fitness journey:

1. Start with simple goals: Don't aim for big goals that are hard to achieve all at once. Start with simple goals like walking for 30 minutes a day, or doing 10 pushups. These small goals will help you build confidence and develop a habit for exercise.

2. Use a fitness app: There are several fitness apps available that can help you track your progress. These apps not only help you track your workout sessions but also measure the number of calories burned and the distance covered.

3. Track your measurements: It's important to track your body measurements to see changes that are not always visible on the scale. Measure your waist, hips, arms, and thighs before starting your fitness journey and then track your progress every few weeks.

4. Write down your goals: Write down your fitness goals in a journal, notebook or even smartphone notes. This will help you revisit your goals when you need to remind yourself what you're working towards.

5. Celebrate small victories: Celebrate every small victory you achieve along the way, even if it's just doing one more rep or cutting 30 seconds off your running time. This will help you stay motivated and encouraged as you continue on your journey.

6. Don't compare yourself to others: It can be tempting to compare your progress with someone else's, but remember that everyone's journey is unique. Focus on your own progress and celebrate your achievements.

7. Don't give up: It's natural to experience setbacks or challenges along the way, but don't let them discourage you. Keep pushing forward and remind yourself why you started this journey in the first place.
